references.reason: This paper introduces a method for measuring compositionality, a key property of human language that the authors aim to replicate in emergent communication.
This paper addresses the challenge of evaluating compositionality in artificial languages, a topic central to the study of emergent communication.

references.paper_title: How agents see things: On visual representations in an emergent language game
references.reason: This paper explores the visual representations used by agents in an emergent communication setting, directly influencing the current work's investigation of spatial meaningfulness.
This paper highlights a counter-intuitive phenomenon in emergent communication where agents may develop strategies that are surprisingly efficient yet lack the properties of human language.

references.paper_title: Compositionality and generalization in emergent languages
references.reason: This paper delves into the relationship between compositionality and generalization, properties essential for meaningful communication, providing valuable context for the current study.
